skill.description: Generate comprehensive onboarding documentation and guides for new developers joining your team o...
skill.summary: Generate comprehensive onboarding documentation and guides for new developers joining your team o...
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown instructions for generating onboarding documentation templates. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Create onboarding documentation for new developers
content.value_statement: New developers often struggle to understand complex projects and team processes. This skill generates comprehensive onboarding guides including environment setup, architecture overviews, first tasks, and team culture documentation tailored to your project.
actual_capabilities: Generates complete onboarding guides with day 1, week 1, and month 1 milestones
Creates development environment setup instructions for any tech stack
Documents team processes, communication channels, and meeting schedules
Produces architecture overviews and codebase structure explanations
Creates first-task tutorials with hands-on exercises
Generates troubleshooting guides and FAQs for common onboarding questions
limitations: Does not execute code or modify your actual project files
Cannot access your existing documentation to read current state
Requires you to provide project details for personalized output
Generates templates that you must review and customize

use_cases.title: Standardize team onboarding
use_cases.description: Create consistent onboarding documentation for all new engineers joining your team or company.

use_cases.title: Document project architecture
use_cases.description: Generate architecture overviews and codebase walkthroughs that help new developers understand your system.

use_cases.title: Create setup guides
use_cases.description: Produce detailed environment setup instructions that reduce time-to-productivity for new team members.

prompt_templates.title: Full Onboarding Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive onboarding guide for our [PROJECT_NAME] project. Include: overview with technology stack, day 1 checklist with environment setup steps, week 1 goals covering architecture basics, month 1 milestones, team structure and contacts, communication channels, and first-week resources.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Start Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a quick-start onboarding document for [PROJECT_NAME]. Focus on essential setup steps, required accounts and access, basic architecture overview, first commit task with step-by-step instructions, and key contacts for help.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an architecture overview document for [PROJECT_NAME]. Include: high-level system diagram description, technology stack breakdown, key services and their responsibilities, data flow explanations, and directory structure with purpose of each major folder.

prompt_templates.title: Team Process Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a team processes guide for our engineering team. Include: git workflow and branch naming conventions, code review practices, deployment process and environments, meeting schedules and purposes, communication channels and when to use each, and on-call rotation information.

output_examples.input: Generate an onboarding guide for our React and Node.js e-commerce project with 12 developers.
output: Welcome Guide with mission, technology stack overview, and project statistics
Day 1 checklist covering accounts, tools installation, repository setup, and first commit
Environment setup instructions for macOS and Windows with required credentials list
Architecture diagram showing frontend-backend-database interaction flow
Directory structure breakdown explaining client and server organization
Week 1 learning path with key concepts, first real task, and code review guidelines
Team structure with names, roles, and contact information for each engineer
Communication channels including Slack channels, meeting schedules, and chat etiquette

best_practices: Provide specific project details like team size, tech stack, and contact names for more personalized guides
Review and customize generated templates to match your actual team processes and culture
Pair generated documentation with hands-on exercises and pair programming sessions
Update onboarding guides quarterly based on feedback from recent new hires
anti_patterns: Do not share sensitive credentials or production access keys in generated documentation
Avoid generating documentation without verifying accuracy against current team practices
Do not skip the FAQ section as it addresses common new developer pain points

faq.question: Which AI tools are compatible with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It requires no additional configuration or API keys.

faq.question: What information should I provide for the best results?
faq.answer: Share project name, tech stack, team size, development workflow, key contacts, and any existing documentation you want incorporated.

faq.question: Can I customize the output format?
faq.answer: Yes. You can specify focus areas, document types, and length preferences. The skill generates markdown that can be converted to any format.

faq.question: Is my project data kept private?
faq.answer: The skill only processes information you provide during the conversation. No data is stored or shared outside your session.

faq.question: Why should I use this instead of writing documentation manually?
faq.answer: The skill provides structured templates and comprehensive outlines that reduce initial writing time while ensuring you cover all essential topics.

faq.question: How does this compare to hiring a technical writer?
faq.answer: This skill accelerates initial documentation creation with templates and structure. A technical writer adds editorial refinement, user research, and ongoing maintenance expertise.
